description:
When a VM has no local disk, resize operation doesn't need to copy disk files over. It doesn't even need to check if the source/dest hypervisors are on a shared file system. Currently, both are attempted anyway:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py#L4894

This relies on the compute hosts being able to freely ssh/scp to each other, which requires setting up ssh keys. Further more, when kerberos is used for ssh authentication, ssh using IPs (the current implementation) simply won't work - full hostname is required.

In the scenario where VM has no local disk, we should simply skip all the ssh/scp work..
title: VM resize: ssh/scp is tried even VM has no local disk

comments.content: For the former issue, instance directories need to be copied, or at the very least created (other files, such as the console log and the XML definition, are stored in the instance directory).  The latter issue is currently being worked on (https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/use-libvirt-storage-pools-for-migration).
